intro: Thymophylla tenuiloba var. wrightii, commonly known as Wright's thymophylla, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh, dry conditions. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a distinctive, pungent aroma, which is a common trait among members of its family. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
